intro: Sericocoma sericea, commonly known as the silky sericocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, silky foliage, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Sericocoma sericea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
